intro: Tetranthera rangoonensis, commonly known as the Rangoon tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and has a creeping growth habit. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a smooth, glossy surface.
